reviews.review_msg: Hilary is a professor that actually cares about her students and the material she is teaching. She wants her students to be the best researchers they can be. Does this involve work? Yes. Its one of the hardest courses I've taken, but it is well worth it, you learn so much. Hilary was always there to help if I needed it and went above and beyond.

She's an okay prof, very knowledgeable about the material. Doesn't post slides most of the time. Midterm average was very low and told us before that most people fail the midterm and it is hard, however if you do 10% better on the final, she will make the final worth more. All SA and LA on exams. TA made the course better. Research project a pain.
It's a tough class, but manageable. She uploads her expectations onto Canvas and gives a lot of feedback. You definitely need to work for your grade, but you also learn a lot.
Amazing lectures, very interesting and inspirational but a very hard marker with difficult tests.

She gives little to no information on how to do assignments and expects a perfect research study that can be published in an academic journal. Having high expectations is fine, but not when you give misleading and vague criteria for assignments.
One of the best prof's. Hard marker but extra caring. Dont judge her yet (in the middle of the semester), wait until the end. You'll be surprised!

One of the best Prof's I've had. She is hard but don't judge by the grades. She makes you work for your grade but in the end, rewards learning and progress (you'll know what I mean by that)! She is extremely knowledgeable and funny, and makes her lectures interesting. I'd definitely take courser with her in the future!

You MUST READ your textbook or you won't pass. She's a hard marker and designs her class assuming you've read the chapter she's going to talk about in lecture. She talks about new things not found in the textbook that are related to the topic 60% of the time, the other 40% is from the textbook. Little info given on her slides.

She's a great professor and cares about her students. Yes you have to put in the work, two large essays and four thought papers. The thought papers are easy. She made the class interesting. She offers bonus marks and she isn't there to screw us over she tells you exactly what she wants. SFU needs more professors like her!

Hilary is funny and entertaining in her lectures as she is interested in what she teaches. However, the mid-term was ridiculous. The "short answer" are not short answers. She expects too much for a first year course. This class will make your GPA drop.

People who don't like Hilary and her teaching style really need to grow up/actually put in effort. As a fourth year I've fully enjoyed taking this WRITING INTENSIVE class with her. She is so helpful and offers chances for bonus and will take the best of the 2 term papers as your grade. She's even making the final optional for grade improvement
LOVE HER

I've had Hilary for 4 Crim classes now, and some of these comments just show me that those students didn't try. It's not an easy mark, but not unreasonable. Yeah, she's a little bit neurotic and I can see how you'd think she was intimidating, but she knows what she's talking about and will really help you out if you go talk to her. Nice lady.

She expects way too much from first year students. Probably the hardest class I have taken. Her exams are okay, but the time allotted is ridiculous!! She expects students to finish short answers (designed like long answers) to be done in as less as 50 minutes. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Not sure why the rating is so low. Took her first semester of uni and got an A-. (Probably could have done better). I'm not saying it's easy but it is manageable.  Make sure you keep up with everything!! About her attitude - I think people just don't get her sarcastic humour? I thought she was hilarious. Was also really helpful in office hours!

She is a tough prof for sure. She makes you work really hard. Her reasoning for being so tough on first year students is to build your skills and prepare you properly for upper level learning. Attend classes, read your text book and prepare to work hard and you'll do fine. She's great and so much fun!

Her class brought my GPA down.   Most lectures stray so far from the textbook its impossible to study for tests.  I find Hilary to be condescending to students and the ego is huge.  I wouldnt take her class again if my degree depended on it.

I'm writing this in class because I honestly felt like expressing my insights for this class. She does not teach anything remotely close to what she puts on the mid terms, book is useless. I spent 4 days studying for this class knowing she's a hard marker, but stil class Average was 54%. With my mark slightly over the average. Do not take her at al
STAY away. She will destroy your GPA and your dreams! Her exams too length and she expects you to know the textbook, short answers aren't short they are LONG ANSWERS!

The worst class. It would have been interesting but Morden is unapproachable. I don't mind hard markers, but she's just unkind and really unhelpful with her feedback. There's a lot of shameless self promotion going on. I definitely do not recommend this instructor.
hard marker, too much expected from first year students

Hilary takes so much time to mark and criticize (in a good way) your papers so you will do better. I've never had a prof at SFU who takes the time like she does to help her students. She turned a dry subject into the class i'm most excited to attend this semester. If you want to do well in school, she is the best person to help you do that.

Hilary is hilarious and extremely knowledgable. Her lectures are fun to attend. Her tests are hard, not in the sense that the questions are difficult, but because you have so many questions in so little time. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat! You need the text  and attending lectures will result in better grades, trust me!
Funniest prof. Always there when you need help and wants you to do well.

Has very interesting lectures and engages students rather than watching her ramble off a powerpoint (don't expect those to be online). The exams and papers are TOUGH for a first-year course - requires lots of work, even marked tough... kind of a huge slap in the face for first years. Does provide help when asked for so you aren't running blindly.
Very passionate teacher, but very unfriendly and unapproachable in my opinion. Very tough marker for a first year class.

Her lectures are very fast-paced. She is strict but fair. This is not a class that you can "cruise" to pass. If you are not really interested in criminology as a discipline, this is probably not a good elective to take. Her lectures are very interesting.

so much regret taking this course. lectures are really boring textbook is not helpful, extremely stressful and painful to read. please don't ever take this course for your good. I should have dropped this course.

Morden is the most condescending prof I've ever had, both to her students and to other grad students.  She makes statements that are blatantly false, but refuses to be corrected (in private and politely). She does try to make the lectures entertaining but this often leads to irrelevant tangents that prevent her from presenting the actual material.

expects students to read one or two whole chapters of textbook in one week and there's a quiz on that every week. lectures are irrelevant to textbook which you'll be quizzed or tested on and makes rude jokes. avoid.

where do I even begin with her. has expectations that are clearly way too high for first year uni course. she thinks its all the students fault that the class average on the midterm was 40 percent and it has nothing to do with her (imagine that) im a 3rd year student for god sakes this instructor is the worst ive had by far. run while you still can

WORST CLASS EVER. There's just too much for us to memorize. And she expects way too much from us. Her short answers are horribly difficult because she doesn't tell us what she expects, and apparently she expects very specific details which normal students probably won't be able to remember. Midterm average was 45% and it's not curved. DONT TAKE IT.

She expects you to work for your mark. If you aren't doing well, ask her why and suck it up... She'll tell you what to do. she treats her students likeep adults, which can be rough on first year students.

Hilary Morden is an absolutely amazing prof. I had her in my first year at SFU and I honestly go out of my way to recommend her to other Crim students. She has lots of experience in the field, and really knows her stuff. She's a tough marker and the exams are not easy, but even with that said, I would take a course with her again. Unparalleled.

I'm doing really well in her class but not because she has been of any help. Morden is one of the most self-righteous, nasty instructors I have ever met. I have never ever heard a good thing about her teaching so why is she still teaching??? She is condescending and rude to students. Would  NOT recommend
Probably the hardest class I've ever taken. I think the LSAT stressed me out less. You vs a bad grade is 300 Spartans vs an entire Persian army.
Just don't do it.   So many regrets.

I had her as a prof for CRIM 101 and she was great, her grading criteria was crystal clear, it was literally 2 pages of her telling us exactly what to do, there is no reason you should be lost. TAs are nit picky about answers on midterms an finals, you have to be spot on. Great prof, engaging, extremely passionate, would take another class with her
Great Prof, terrific lady as well....

Hilary comes across as rude and tough at first but she did try to make lectures fun and engaging. She doesn't have tolerance for chatting during class time. Read and attend lectures for the weekly iClicker quizzes and you will be fine. The paper was marked relatively easy, and the exams were okay.

Hilary is the worst prof I have had at SFU in two years. Don't get me wrong, she is a very intelligent person and I genuinely think she could be a great prof but her attitude toward students, lack of clarity in what is expected, and overall disorganization in terms of administrative tasks is frustrating to say the least.

Hilary is a great prof. She is not easy but gives you many chances to do well. Hard, but if you attend all the lectures and take notes on what she says in class you are guaranteed to do well. The people who complain about her being tough are definitely the ones who don't listen to her instructions,she is crystal clear about how to do well.

Her lectures are long and boring because she tends to get off topic really easily. She didn't give us enough time for our midterm (50 minutes for the essay), so more than half the class didn't complete that part. We also have an iClicker quiz at the end of every lecture. Overall, passing  isn't hard for this course, but you have to know your stuff.

Slides are not put up online.  Midterm mainly based on the textbook. I-clicker quiz at the end of every class, make sure to read additional supplementary articles. Midterm was difficult, given an hour to write an essay.  Short answers need to be very detailed and specific.  Final based on everything.  Gives extra bonus percentages.

One of the worst profs I've had.  Her incredibly large ego and a self-righteous demeanour was unpleasant to experience. Additionally exams were very difficult to prepare for due to a lack of clarity in what students were expected to know. Unrealistic expectations for a first year course. Do not take a class with her unless you have no other option.

hold onto your seat during this course! INFORMATION OVERLOAD is no exaggeration. ALL written long answer & case study (essay) for mid-term & final. Unreasonable expectations of content memorization. Unclear delivery, confuses concepts, misspells names. Interesting content though. Somewhat useful to see in office hrs/appt if you can get one! YIKES!

Hilary is a great teacher! She is interesting to listen to and is passionate about Crim. She is a no bs person, if you don't put the effort in she wont put the effort into you. I would take her again.

While Hilary is definitely interested in the subject matter, she does not plan a course very well. If you take her class, make sure you take extra time understand what she expects from you. It is possible to do well in her class however, she doesn't make it easy, and not by making the course difficult but by having very specific expectations.

She does expect you to treat this like a university course.  She cares - gives out her personal cell number.  She wants you to do well and will do whatever it takes to help you get there.  But you will have to work - this is university after all.

She was very fair, it was a challenging course and I had to put effort in to do well. Don't expect to pass, if you don't want to take the time to study. But if you follow her advice you will do just fine.
stay away if you want to save your GPA, worst proff ever. So rude and her attitude is terrible.
Hilary is an amazing prof! she can be really tough but she is always there to help and offers an amazing experience. Keeps the class entertained thats for sure!
learning so much i am! so interesting it is.  recommend this class i do

Was super helpful and always ready and willing to put in extra time to assist students. Fantastic T.A. for 321. I was struggling until I went for help. If you're not getting a good grade, go ask! You shouldn't expect higher than a B if you don't try to use her help to better your scores. You can't coast like high school in University!
The entire mid term was on her lecture notes. don't buy the text book I don't even own it and im passing
She is one difficult TA.
nit picky and difficult TA. Her attitude toward students is condecending and mean. take her if u want to kill your GPA

Her attitude towards students is condecending, mean and rude. so nit picky who takes mark off for extra space between period in APA format? Class average was C- but apparently nothing wrong with her and prof and everything's OUR fault. Well shes always right u just have to suck it up. So full of herself

WORST TA ever. Shes just bad tempered and her attitude toward students is condescending mean and rude. Also nit picky. Who takes marks off for extra space between period in APA format? She doesnt know what its like to be a student and so self-righteous that even if the class average is C-, its OUR fault for not studying enough, not hers.
Worst prof EVER! She is mean and unhelpful. Her lectures are boring. Not recommended AT ALL!

where do i even begin? hilary is the hardest marking TA i have ever had in my 4 years at SFU. she will criticize every little thing on your paper. she will tell you your paper is wrong from top to bottom. class average on 2 papers were 61% and 63%. she is a harsh, unforgiving, and unhelpful TA. although she marked fairly easy on the in-class exam
Hillary is the worst Crime prof that I v ever experienced in SFU. She is selfish, mean, condescending students and she ll make you hate Criminology. I don't command her at all

Hilary can be really nice and has some good stories, but from my experience & from what I've seen she's impatient dealing w/ students. I've had her as both a T.A & a professor, & honestly, I would not recommend her for either role; she can come off as condescending when you ask a question & even via dist. ed. she's unapproachable! Hard marker.

Unreasonably hard class. . No structure in either lectures or tutorials. Gave us a terrible textbook that was no help whatsoever, then gave the most vague notes possible and still expected in depth analysis on exams... Take this class with a different prof and stay clear of the TA (Bryce) he is nice but useless and an unreasonably hard marker

When she does not record her lectures or do not allow students to record, she should at least be clearer in her slides. When she is whizzing through 50+ slides in 1hr50mins, it is very hard to keep up. There's A LOT of information you'll need to know in order to feel like you've done okay in the exams. Really harsh marker as well.

Take this course if you don't care about your grade. Her lectures are not organized. Textbook is not needed. Exams are hard, the average of the midterm was 65%. She is a tough marker. So shocked when I got my paper back. Stuffs could've been interesting but this course was so boring. Tutorials were meaningless. Don't expect anything for this course

She seems like a nice person, and can be funny. Pretty good, considering she's not a seasoned lecturer. That said, her tests, and the course in general, were too hard for a 100 level crim course. Also, the textbook was useless (though, this is not her fault). Only take this class if it is required for your program, regardless of the prof.
When the average on exams is literally only 60% in an intro CRIM course, theres obviously something wrong with the prof and TA, not all 105 students...
Text is useless, TA and her can't agree on anything. Honestly, nobody seems to know what's going on. She even contradicts herself regularly.
She is nice but this course is way too hard though it is 100 level. Exams are difficult and sometimes lectures are not well organized. Tutorials are also sometimes full of meaningless stuffs.

She is nice but this course is way to hard for an intro CRIM class. The avg is like 65% when it should be 75% since its not curved. The TA (Bryce) is helpful and nice but can be an unreasonable marker for a 100-level course, and since Hillary gives poor lecture notes and the textbook is a very poor choice, it is difficult to do well.

I took this last spring, and my marks have improved immensely (B+ to A+). Hilary actually takes time to criticize your work, other TAs don't. You can't LEARN unless u accept your flaws. If you want to learn, she is super helpful. If you want to cruise through uni w/out academic improvement, then suit yourself -- she's not easy, but she is the best.

Yes, she's hard - but really fair.  She stayed extra hours for office hours and was willing to go through my essay line by line to help me with my writing.  My essay marks have gone up a full grade since. She is focused on helping students to achieve the very best possible.

Don't even bother with this woman as your TA. Marks you like you are in your 4th year and expects way too much from students. Too nit picky. If she is your TA either drop or switch. Your gpa depends on it.
STAY AWAY AT ALL TIMES. WORST TA I'VE EVER HAD. She will say your essay is wrong from top to bottom
HORRIBLE TA. STAY AWAY FROM HER. Not useful. Only focuses on wrong APA practices. Doesn't even discuss about the paper content. She's horrible.
